conversation.message: School_E is my first-choice school. I’m very interested in joining your program and contributing actively to the school community. I’d like to formally apply for your available seat and would be honored to be considered.

conversation.message: Student_B, thank you for your application and for placing School_E as your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_E. Please confirm you will enroll, and we look forward to welcoming you to our community.
conversation.thought: As School_E, my true priority order is Student_E > Student_B > Student_A > Student_D > Student_C. In this round I received [APPLY] from Student_B, Student_A, and Student_D. Among these, Student_B is the highest on my list. Although Student_E is my top choice, Student_E’s preferences place School_E last, so it is very unlikely they will apply to me, especially early. If I reject Student_B now hoping for Student_E, I risk losing my best realistic option and could end up with a lower-priority student or an unfilled seat. Since quota is 1 and accepting Student_B secures a high-priority match immediately, I should accept Student_B.
